text:
I see there are some changes to the JMeter 2.8 version compared to 2.7 and I see the property "Jincludecontroller.prefix" is missing in Jmeter 2.8. Not sure whether it is intentional.

Can anybody confirm it whether it is intentional? 

If it is intentional is there any other way included so that i can get the same functionality when i use "Jincludecontroller.prefix" to include my Include controllers.
creator: pnkotti@gmail.com
p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
text:
includecontroller.prefix is still available.
But its default value is empty.

You probably didn't copy your old jmeter.properties/user.properties from 2.7 install

creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com

creator: pnkotti@gmail.com
text:
Even after updating the property Jincludecontroller.prefix it is still taking the base as  apache bin directory.

Below is the property updated in the jmeter.bat file and the error in the console is mention below:

jmeter.bat:

%JM_START% %JM_LAUNCH% %ARGS% %JVM_ARGS% -jar "%JMETER_BIN%ApacheJMeter.jar" %JMETER_CMD_LINE_ARGS%

Jincludecontroller.prefix=E:\JMETER\jmeter\branches\testplan\

Error in console:
 ERROR - jmeter.control.IncludeController: loadIncludedElements -failed for: C:\apache-jmeter-2.8\bin\DirectoryFunctions\fProfile_SEO_Public_Profile.jmx 

Please let me know where i am exactly wrong.

Bugzilla is not a support forum.
Please ask your question on jmeter mailing list.

You will certainly have answers there.
creator: p.mouawad@ubik-ingenierie.com
